summary: The document is a memorandum from the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) detailing Lawrence Huber Florer's military service in the United States Air Force. It covers his enlistment, assignments, promotions, personal background, and health records, concluding with no disciplinary actions noted.
key_findings: Lawrence Huber Florer enlisted in the United States Air Force on August 30, 1962, in Dallas, Texas, and was honorably discharged on August 29, 1968.
Assigned to the 136th Air Refueling Group, Texas Air National Guard, Florer was promoted from Basic Airman to Sergeant.
Born in Dallas, Texas, on July 25, 1940, Florer graduated from N.T.S.U. with a B.B.A. in accounting in 1962 and married Barbara Watson in 1966.
His military service was primarily conducted on weekends, with no special education beyond basic training.
Medical records indicate normal health, detailing vision, a scar, and physical attributes.
No disciplinary actions were recorded in his military file.
